author: {'steamid': '76561197998110256', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1018, 'last_played': 1515806083}
review: Neat dungeonner, with very simple mechanics but still very tactical. Think Hero Quest.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029868886', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 3007, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 896, 'last_played': 1609560646}
review:
Gamers like Bullfrog and Brilyn don't seem to get what early access means. This game is being updated and built upon on a roughly bi-weekly basis. The last update unlocked more levels, patched errors and the developers asked for feedback on making new quests and balance issues.

As for price and gameplay, for the first the game may have only had 12-14 accessable levels a month or two ago from the time of this review, but its growing now. Read the description of the game.  And the gameplay, if you don't see gameplay footage on the store page go to youtube to check the game out to see if it's for you.


Been playing games since the mid 80's, and this is one of the funnest I have ever played. Its simple, addictive, a little flawed - but getting better each and every week with great updates. I've finished all the levels but there are another 8 levels they are still working on that I am looking forward to playing. Each class has 7 ability/spells that you can claim and then upgrade and you can craft gear to better prepare yourself in different levels. Having a shield will protect you from arrows, important when those goblin archers have you in their sites. Its worth a try, and now I'm going for DQ1  !!

author: {'steamid': '76561197986286716', 'num_games_owned': 213, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1499253093}
review: nice game

author: {'steamid': '76561198034698929', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1575066052}
review:
Being an old fan of the boardgames Heroquest (and later D&D boardgame), I was pleasantly surprised to discover the game Dark Quest 2. 

Dark Quest 2 brings a lite-version of those boardgames, with gorgeous handdrawn graphics and a great dungeoncrawl-feel to it. An added bonus is the mapeditor for infinite content to even extend replayability.

Pros: 
- dungeons
- loot
- multiplayer
- mapeditor
- great soundtrack

Cons:
- more keyshortcuts would be nice

author: {'steamid': '76561198047549283', 'num_games_owned': 129, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 579, 'last_played': 1586903286}
review:
Thumps up!

Just trying and keep it short an clean. [Written during Early Access Phase / ~10 Hours into the Game]

+ HeroQuest flair!
+ Lovely Artworks
+ Grinding and Looting Deluxe
+ Soundtrack very fitting
+ Coop feels just awesome
+ Great Support!

- Mechanics can be exploited pretty easily (terms of leveling)
- Skill cap reached pretty quickly
- (Minor) Teething problems, but no bugs so far!
- Replayability, long-term motivation, balancing questionable (at this point of the development)

Short but fun experience, especially for Tabletop Roleplay aficionados! Definitely something to keep an eye on.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970435474', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 157, 'playtime_forever': 378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1668635506}
review:
This is very much a heroquest inspired game and fans of that board game will probably get more out of this than people who never played that.

The graphics are a great improvement over the first game and look pretty nice with an 80's cartoon/tabletop feel and i find the quests fun. There's also a dungeon builder tool which will greatly improve the longevity and provide entertainment in itself if creating dungeons is your thing. And a possibility of a procedural generated based expansion coming up which would be awesome if done right.

Those complaining about the games difficulty may have not noticed that you can replay earlier dungeons, which whilst grindy, is a good way to make sure you are well equipped and prepared for the more difficult dungeons. I also like the in game global chat, tales of maj'eyal has something like that too and its a good way to ask advice from other players if the numbers are there.

So, good game, glad i finally got around to getting it! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198109352410', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1801, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1651, 'last_played': 1502493227}
review:
Dark Quest 2 ist an die alten Fantasy-Brettspiele wie Hero Quest angelehnt. Man f√ºhrt eine Gruppe aus max. 3 Helden, die man aus einem Kader von bisher 7 Helden zusammenstellt durch verschiedene Dungeons. Die K√§mpfe sind rundenbasierend. Graphik und Animationen im speziellen Comic-Retro-Look und Musik sind f√ºr das Spielerlebnis ausreichend.
Die einzelnen Charaktere werden durch Abilities und Skills im Laufe des Spiels st√§rker, je mehr Urnen man bei seinen Abenteuern erbeutet.  Das Spiel hat noch ein paar kleine Verbesserungen n√∂tig. Z.B. Der "Zufallssch√§del" f√ºgt Einem in 8 von 10 F√§llen 2 Schaden zu .Nachdem man es ein paar Mal ausprobiert hat l√§sst man es lieber ganz. Der Anfang kann etwas knifflig sein, wenn die Helden noch nicht so viel k√∂nnen Au√üerdem kommen hoffentlich mehr Levels, mehr Charaktere, mehr Gegenst√§nde, mehr Taktikelemente, einfach noch mehr Inhalt bis zum Release.

Alles in Allem ist hier ein Spiel mit viel Potential, welches allerdings erst noch weiter ausgebaut werden muss. In jedem Fall aber schon spielbar und fesselnd. Daumen hoch.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986624324', 'num_games_owned': 567, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 435, 'last_played': 1583634599}
review:
Apesar de n√£o ser oficial. O dark quest 2 √© uma c√≥pia do antigo jogo de tabuleiro chamado Hero Quest, que foi lan√ßado no Brasil pela Estrela. O jogo √© bem legal, tem uma dificuldade bem desafiadora e pode jogar cooperativo com at√© mais 3 amigos, cada um com uma das classes.
Para quem ama RPG, board games e jogos cooperativos √© um prato cheio.
Recomendo n√£o s√≥ o dark quest 2, como tamb√©m o dark quest 1 que tem uma vis√£o bem board game e √© t√£o divertido quanto, apesar dos gr√°ficos serem bem mais simples.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041229794', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1496216166}
review:
This down vote is mostly because of the cost.

There really isn't much game here and I became bored pretty quickly.  I get that it's early access, but I feel it would suit a mobile platform better where simple gameplay is ok and you play in short stints.

It's not really the nostalgic old school adventure I expected.  I'd recommend buying it only if it's less than $5 and you don't expect more than a short casual adventure game for your tablet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056018413', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 670, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 670, 'last_played': 1494202624}

author: {'steamid': '76561198026679609', 'num_games_owned': 1456, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1515462624}
review:
This is a pretty terrible game, put together quit cheaply. The graphics aren't awful, but would be best considered mediocre. The combat is turn-based, but *extremely* simplistic.

Story? No, there's no story. "Evil wizard lives in castle, you're going to the castle because the Evil Wizard lives there". No effort went into the narrative *at all*.

I finally gave up after walking into a trap, and the game told me "hey, you can avoid traps by carrying a torch". Lol, wut? That's not how traps work, *and* the walls are covered in goddamn torches.

Garbage.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032588422', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 407, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1650740116}
review: F√ºr alle, die vor ca.100 Jahren "HeroQuest" als Brettspiel oder ebenfalls "HeroQuest" auf Amiga gespielt haben UND es gemocht haben - ist "Dark Quest 2" ein Muss. Es ist um einiges komplexer als "HeroQuest": es gibt Ausr√ºstugsgegenst√§nde,  mehr Heldentypen und verschiedene Aktionen und Skills, die man erlernen kann. Da das Spiel noch in der Entwicklungsphase ist, sind noch nicht alle Dungeons freigeschaltet. Ich finde es jetzt schon geil.

author: {'steamid': '76561198110094218', 'num_games_owned': 517, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1547873361}
review: This game has potential. Alot of it.  Looks great, plays great, and it's simple and easy in a good way.  Nothing complicated, just easy time wasting fun.  And perfectly suited to the price point.  Multiplayer needs some work, namely a lobby or drop-in and out play, but its in early access. I look forward to seeing where the developers take this.  Oh and co-op.  This game needs local co-op.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046140987', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 2099, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1066, 'last_played': 1693429260}
review:

1. Die Campagne ist nach so langer Zeit immer noch unvollst√§ndig !

3. Das gr√∂√üte √úbel jedoch ist, da√ü es keine ordentliche und detaillierte Editor-Dokumentation

          werde ich zu gr√∂√üten Fan dieses im Grunde hervorragenden Spiels und k√∂nnte es danach empfehlen

author: {'steamid': '76561198054880803', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 390, 'last_played': 1491242919}
review:
Jogo promissor, se voce jogou heroquest ou algum RPG de tabuleiro, Dark Quest √© compra obrigatoria, o jogo ainda esta em desenvolvimento e possui alguns bugs, mas nada que atrapalhe o gameplay.
Recomendo farmar Skill Elixir no segundo mapa para upar as skills dos seus herois antes de partir para novas aventuras.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070091020', 'num_games_owned': 801, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 47590, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3810, 'last_played': 1689977952}
review:
Dass Dark Quest 2 derzeit nur Early-Access (Stand: 31.03.17) ist, merkt man schon an diversen Stellen. So sind z.B. derzeit 19 der 30 Maps der Kampagne spielbar und noch nicht alle Helden verf√ºgbar.
Die Balance ist auch noch nicht ganz ausgewogen und k√∂nnte noch etwas angepasst werden. Alles in allem aber nichts, was den Spielspa√ü mindern k√∂nnte.

Trotz Early-Access hat das Spiel durchaus Potenzial und macht mir bisher wirklich Spa√ü. Ich f√ºhle mich ein St√ºck weit an Hero Quest erinnert und bin gespannt, was die Zukunft noch so bringt. Auf den ersten Blick wirkt es eher simpel, allerdings kommt mit weiteren F√§higkeiten, welche die Helden erlernen k√∂nnen, mehr Tiefe ins Spiel.

Der Editor bietet viele M√∂glichkeiten, die bestehende Auswahl an Quests nach Belieben zu erweitern (selbst erstellte oder durch die Community ‚Äì in der Hoffung, dass es zuk√ºnftig noch mehr werden).
Bei einer Frage zum Editor im Forum habe ich bereits innerhalb einer Stunde Hilfe vom Entwickler bekommen. Auch sonst scheint der Entwickler interessiert an der Community. Das finde ich sehr positiv!

Der Multiplayer funktioniert schon, k√∂nnte aber noch etwas optimiert werden. Beispielsweise ist bei 2 Spielern auf einer Karte f√ºr 3 Helden ein Heldenplatz unbesetzt, so dass die Quest herausfordernder wird.

Der Preis von 12,99‚Ç¨ hat mich anfangs davon abgehalten, das Spiel zu kaufen, so dass ich auf ein Angebot gewartet habe. Im Nachhinein muss ich aber sagen, dass mir das Spiel auch 12,99‚Ç¨ wert gewesen w√§re, da ich davon ausgehe, dass es auch noch weitere Inhalte geben wird.

Von mir also eine klare Kaufempfehlung!

author: {'steamid': '76561198011561313', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4530, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1029, 'last_played': 1676485033}
review:
Greetings jung lad. Come and take a seat. I will tell you from a time of darkness...
It all took place in a world, similar to one we know, but different enough to be worth another story.
Were a handful of heroes gathered to defeat the evil sorcerer Zantor. For ages he dwelled in the darkness, raising his foul minions unter his iront fist, and one after the other, free lands fall before him.
Mighty castles turned into lairs of terror, swarmed by his minions, til a few remaining heroes gathered:
The wild barbarian, the wise wizard, the studdy dwarf, the mysterious dark monk, the swift archer and the honorable knight. Together, under the leadership of the barbarian warrior, they march towards the darkest of all places in the world: Zantors Keep.
Be the way were long and danger were everywhere. The first quest were easy, not more than a tutorial for the barbarian, who were alone in the beginning, til the wizard found him and together, they did another quest. And another, and...
Reaching a village that no map knows, they realized the adventure has even just begun. 
More enemies raised upon them, deadly traps waited patiently for their blood, and in every shadow, there were these eyes. Watching, waiting. 
The villagers had them welcome and here the heroes found, whatever they could need:
A blacksmith, crafting weapons and armor, even artifacts.
An old Woman, selling potions of strange herbs - useful, but unstable in quality.
A sage of the old realms, who tought our heroes to master her abilities.
A Merchant, buying juwels and items the heroes didn't need anymore.
And the gravedigger, who could even brought back the dead (and were the richest men in town).
The tavern provided a rest for the wounded, while the brothel...well :)

And there he were. The eldar. A strange old man, who sent for the barbarian and his mates.
He gave them advice and - more important - quests. 
Rescue the dwarf he said, for the dungeons get bigger and harder as you proceed, and 2 heros soon won't be enough.

The tale seems simple young lad, but you surely will be entertained well. The fights were simple, the graphic and sound nostalgic. The devs of the kingdom were busy these days, even in the forums, what is always a good sign.
Go now, adventurer. Go for the honor, for the gold and get your own tale to tell....

author: {'steamid': '76561198078498143', 'num_games_owned': 2152, 'num_reviews': 315, 'playtime_forever': 908, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 764, 'last_played': 1519675934}
review:
Take a step back into the good old times where Computers were just in beginning. A time without Smartphones, with simple Consoles like the ATARI 2600. That was the time of Table Games. Sitting together, rolling the dices, playing cards, setting Figures. One Table Game was HERO QUEST. This Game was special, because it was one of the first games that was able to change the Gamefield. You choose one Character, take your dice and go into an adventure. 
The Characters are different. A Mage, a Dwarf, a Barbarian, an Archer and in following Add Ons more Characters. Each Character has special abilitys to survive the Game. Winning this Game depends very much on Luck.
You roll the Dice, you accept the Dice. 
The Final Goal is to defeat an evil Mage. The way is full of enemys and traps. A long way.

Yes, i was speaking of HERO QUEST, but this is also DARK QUEST 2. 
And no, i don`t think it is a stolen idea, for me it is a homage, a tribute to an old game.
Many Years ago there was a homecomputer Version i liked very much, but that was in the 80`s. From that time on i was waiting for a new version and i found it in DARK QUEST 1. It was in 2D, not like the AMIGA Version, but now with DARK QUEST 2 i reached what i was searching for.

DARK QUEST 2 has it all. Good Graphics in Old School Style, an atmospheric Soundtrack and a nice Gameplay. For me its a little bit like coming home, after all the years. Thank you very much Brain Seal LTD. :)

This Game is Early Access and many areas on the Castlemap are Locked, because they are not ready. Not all Characters are playable but 5 are. The Developer brought in fresh ideas like a City with some Shops. You can buy items and potions there, which are essential for your goings in the Castle. You can also use special Bottles that can be found on adventering  to raise the abilitys and skills of your Characters. 
And this is the point that makes this game fair and not inbalanced. The more you raise you Skills and abillitys the better you survive. I didn`t found a map that is unfair, all can be done with the right preparation and plannings. For example momently i`m using 3 Characters. The Barbarian for Fighting/Tanking, the Dwarf for finding and disarming Traps and the Knight for healing.  It really goes well for me.
BUT NEVER FORGET, like rolling a dice on the Table Game, here the Rollings depends on LUCK. You can have good ones and have a fine run in a room full of monsters or you can have a bad run and loose. 
It`s a fair game and in the beginning it may be a little bit difficult to reach higher Maps, but learn the specializing of the Characters, choose your Favourites, rise them, give them Weapons and Potions and you will success.

I hope in the Future some of my Friendlist will get this game, too, because of a nice Multiplayer Game. For now i`m excited to see whats coming in the future and the Developer did very much in the last Time to continue finishing this game. So if you like good old Table Games, you`re in.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102094986', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1698593012}
review:
Comprei pq havia adorado o Dark Quest 1. Decep√ß√£o. Embora tenha bem mais elementos de RPG, a vis√£o isom√©trica por comodos, n√£o se mostrou legal para esse tipo de game... A vers√£o topdown de mapa, utilizada pelo Dark Quest 1, √© bem melhor.  Enfim, os gr√°ficos ficaram bem bonitos, mas continuo preferindo a primeira vers√£o do game... Uma pena

Voltei a joga-lo, depois de uns meses, para ver o que tinha mudado, pois gostei muito do primeiro... Realmente essa vis√£o isom√©trica, por salas, n√£o ficou "caiu bem" para esse tipo de game... Uma pena. Se mantivessem a vis√£o topdown... Tipico jogo que poderia ter sido destinado  para mobile....

author: {'steamid': '76561198187888530', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 794, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 627, 'last_played': 1595449716}
review:
Das Spiel macht sehr viel Spa√ü. Die Grafik ist sehr angenehm und passt super zum Genre. Es spielt sich wie ein Brettspiel. Ich war fr√ºher ein gro√üer Fan des Heroquest Brettspiels und dieses PC-Spiel kommt schon nahe heran.

Was noch fehlt ist eine Map f√ºr die R√§ume die man bereits entdeckt hat. 

Was man leider noch vermeiden muss, ist der Multiplayer, f√ºr den ich das Spiel haupts√§chlich gekauft habe. Immer wieder kommt es vor, dass es mitten im Dungeon nicht mehr m√∂glich ist, den Charakter zu bewegen.

Nat√ºrlich habe ich nicht vergessen, dass es ein Early Access ist, aber auch ein Early Access sollte spielbar sein. Das ist der Multiplayermodus definitv nicht! (Laut Entwickler wurde der Fehler behoben.)

Trotz der Makel ist es ein sehr sch√∂nes Spiel, welches ich weiter beobachten werde. Ich hoffe, dass die Fehler mit der Zeit entfernt werden. Allerdings ist es so seien 15 EUR noch nicht wert. Leider.

Edit: Was ich wirklich erw√§hnen muss: Der Entwickler zeigt wirklich Intresse an Problemen im Spiel. Er hat mich selbstst√§ndig angeschreiben und sich erkundigt, wo es gehapert hat. Sucht eine L√∂sung und wollte sogar mit mir das Spiel gemiensam spielen, um zu testen, ob es wieder funktioniert. Daumen hoch!

author: {'steamid': '76561198014239944', 'num_games_owned': 568, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 862, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1583927190}
review: A gameplay √© muito baseada na sorte, at√© mesmo para um RPG. Quando voc√™ completa uma quest se sente sortudo e n√£o habilidoso.  Tentei apos alguns meses, mais uma vez esse jogo e notei que foram feitas algumas altera√ß√µes, mas ainda penso que n√£o vale a pena, as habilidades e os itens s√£o confusas de entender s√≥ pela descri√ß√£o, √© mais f√°cil entender com o uso na pratica, mas gera muita frustra√ß√£o porque o resultado geralmente √© diferente daquele que vc planejou com base nas descri√ß√µes. N√£o d√° pra vc planejar o posicionamento dos seus personagens quando entra na sala de modo que os personagens com defesa alta fique na linha de frente e aqueles com defesa mais baixa fiquem na retaguarda e isso em um RPG √© fundamental. Por fim  os personagens lutadores corpo a corpo como o b√°rbaro e o guerreiro tem um √≠ndice de acerto muito baixo e ainda por cima com dano baixo (m√©dia de 2 de dano quando acerta) e como na maioria das vezes vc est√° em menor numero acaba dependendo da sorte....uma pena por o jogo poderia ser um RPG leve de rodar no PC e casual.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129370019', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 773, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 502, 'last_played': 1491314601}
review:
I thought this was going to be like Hero Quest games of old.  Am I missing something ?  This game has no balance to it whatsoever.  There is dozens of ways your characters get screwed and very limited number of ways you can buff them to prevent that.  On top of that a lot of it is locked at the beginning to its a bunch of save and reload.

You can't speedup the animations, yes there is an option for that, but it doesn't work.

Nice graphics.  Responsive devs, still bugs being ironed out.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971338654', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1478861431}
review:
** Note: I haven't put a ton of time in yet, but I believe I have enough experience to write a review of the early access status of the title.

Dark Quest 2 is a turn based RPG that reminds me of Darkest Dungeon. I make that comparison in all the best ways especially in the way that, like Darkest Dungeon, this game might be in early access but is full of content, mostly bug free and already has solid gameplay mechanics that are fun and engaging. 

You control a party of heroes in a quest to defeat an evil sorcerer. To do this, you must do battle in a series of dungeons while managing your team in town between missions. It's very addicting and well worth the budget price tag. 

Pros
- Great art style and music
- Challenging but fair gameplay
- Runs great and is easy on the wallet

Cons
- Settings and characters are really generic

Suggestions
- Would be great if the maximum movement restriction could be removed when rooms are free of enemies. Kinda annoying having to switch between your characters 2-3 times just to move through an empty room
- Keybindings plz?

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HXHiJSBb_zo

author: {'steamid': '76561198072064881', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 705, 'last_played': 1484759635}
review:
[German]
Ich habe das Spiel jetzt √ºber 3 Stunden gespielt und bin begeistert. M√ºsste ich morgen nicht fr√ºh raus w√ºrde ich weiter spielen. Das Spiel macht noch wesentlich mehr Spa√ü als der erste Teil und macht vieles besser, vor allem die Motivation bleibt aufrecht erhalten.

Das Spiel lohnt sich f√ºr Spieler von Brettspielen oder Rundenbasierenden Strategiespielen!!!

[English]
I loved the first Darkquest but Darkquest 2 is more fun. They did change some things in the game and this makes the game very fresh and funny.

Everyone who likes the tabletop Heroquest or roundbased strategie games should try this game!!!
It's worth it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198098634404', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1520551412}
review:
This is a first impression review of sorts and I will write an indepth review later.

I love the art style and it seems to have captured the essence of Hero Quest, but where is the hot seat option for multiplayer?!

Game looks good and plays really well with a simplistic and user-friendly interface. I like the music, although it's nowhere near the epic theme music from Hero Quest :)

The game is still early access but it doesn't feel like it. 

Gotta get back to playing :D
